question: 人形
sourceMnemonic: Something that is <kanji>person</kanji> <kanji>shape</kanji>d that isn't a person? That has to be some kind of <vocabulary>doll</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>puppet</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. Since <ja>人</ja> has two on'yomi readings, and the reading of <ja>形</ja> is a bit of an oddball, here's a mnemonic to help you:

Did you know that all <vocabulary>doll</vocabulary>s at <reading>Nin</reading>tendo are made out of <reading>gyo</reading>za dumplings (<ja>にんぎょう</ja>)? They'll also regularly try to get you to eat them... Mmmm, gyoza dolls. Don't be afraid to take a bite!
